review: I have a Roku 3 and now have a Chromecast.  I got the Chromecast so I could cast YouTube and mirror chromebook browser pages from my Nexus 7.  It works.  Sometimes it freezes up.  That is a real pain but I can live with it.  The mirroring is nice and it handles the audio well from webpages and YouTube.If you want to watch Netflix, the best platform is the Roku 3.  It is a great interface, it loads the video stream quickly and it doesn't freeze up like the Chromecast tends to do periodically.  Roku also seems to be less tied to the network you are on.  In other words, it's easy to move the Roku to another wireless network if you are at, say, a hotel or Grandmas place.  I think it would be a pain to try that with Chromecast .. I haven't tried it yet but it appears to be tied to your local network in your house.  If you want to cast or mirror stuff from a Nexus 7 android device, then Chromecast is your man.  If you want to watch Netflix ... Roku is clearly and completely superior.  I like to do both and so I got both.

review: I saw ads for the Chromecast and was very excited. However, getting it home, it gobbles up your wifi like nobody's business. My little router couldn't handle the pressure.
